section.title: Introduction
section.p: You can specify default values for card properties for each card type.
When a new card is created, its properties will be pre-populated with the specified defaults.

subsection.title: Navigate to the card defaults page

steps.item: Sign in to Mingle as a project administrator and open the project (if you're not already working in the project).

item.p: Mingle displays the Project settings page.
item.note: if you are logged in as a project team member, Mingle displays the Team page.

screenshot.alttext: Project admin menu - Card types link

item.p: Mingle displays the Card types page with all card types setup for this project.

screenshot.alttext: Card types page - new card type

item.p: Click on the Edit defaults link next to the card type you want to set defaults for.
Mingle displays the Edit defaults page for the card type

subsection.title: Card description
subsection.p: You can type in any text or markup that you want to have pre-populated into the card description. This can include tables and charts (and any other macros that can be used in pages).
You can specify a default value for a property by clicking on the property name link and selecting a value.

subsection.title: Checklists
subsection.p: You can set up a checklist for each card type. Any card you spin up of this type will have a preset checklist.
You can still add, remove and edit checklist items on individual cards.

subsection.title: Managed list properties
subsection.p: Managed list properties can be defaulted to (not set) or any valid item from the list.

screenshot.alttext: Card defaults - managed list property options

subsection.title: Date properties
subsection.p: Date properties can be defaulted to either (not set) or (today). The latter will insert the date that the card is created into the property.

subsection.title: Team member properties
subsection.p: Team member properties can be defaulted to either (not set) or (current user). The latter will insert the user who created the card into the property.

screenshot.alttext: Card defaults - team member property options

subsection.title: Relationship properties
subsection.p: Relationship properties can be defaulted to (not set), or to any card of the appropriate type that is already a member of the corresponding card tree.
Click on the relationship property name link to bring up a selection dialog listing the available cards.
